triples.name: Lean (proof assistant)
triples.relevance: Lean4 is the formal verification tool used to mechanize the arbitration games and implement machine-checkable winning strategies.

triples.name: Blockchain
triples.relevance: Blockchains are the underlying trusted infrastructure that validates the results of L2 computations through fraud proofs.

triples.name: Layer-1 blockchain
triples.relevance: Layer 1 blockchains provide the security guarantees and settlement layer for Layer 2 optimistic rollups.

triples.name: Game theory
triples.relevance: Game theory provides the mathematical foundation for analyzing arbitration games as two-player strategic interactions.

triples.name: Binary tree
triples.relevance: The paper proposes arbitration games over finite binary trees as a formal structure for data availability and membership checking.

triples.name: Formal verification
triples.relevance: The paper introduces formal verification of winning strategies and dispute resolution, ensuring correctness of fraud proofs mechanically.

triples.name: Lightning Network
triples.relevance: The Lightning Network is an example of Layer 2 scaling solutions that rely on similar dispute resolution mechanisms to arbitration games.

triples.name: Proof assistant
triples.relevance: Proof assistants like Lean4 are essential tools for mechanizing and verifying mathematical proofs in formal systems.

triples.name: Arbitration
triples.relevance: The paper formalizes arbitration as a game-theoretic dispute resolution mechanism with formal winning strategies.

triples.name: Cryptocurrency
triples.relevance: Cryptocurrencies like Ethereum rely on L2 scaling solutions that use arbitration games for dispute resolution.
